fieldDescription.s: Account key. System-wide uniqueness is not guaranteed, so this along with source make up the business key for this object
Relationship between party and account e.g., Sole Owner, Joint Owner, etc. A party can have one or more relationships with a given account e.g., Guarantor and Power of Attorney
Business key for this object
Primary Category: Example: Telephone / Email
Business key for this object. Should be used in conjunction with occurrenceNumber
The actual mobile / phone number or email id
Part of the composite business key for this object
The date and time, to millisecond precision, the record was first created
The person / account who last updated the record
The date and time, to millisecond precision, the record was updated last
Indicator whether a Party is Active / Inactive / Deceased / etc
Party level sequence Id. This can help identify missed events, if any
This would be the Global Sequence Id, unique to each event generated out of MDM
Event Data would be specific for a eventType so this field would help identify what to expect in Event Data

A unique identifier for this particular event.  The event producer allocates the eventId. Has to be in UUID v4 format (i.e. 535c3d5d-fc48-4f08-b85c-1a986e9d1234). OCV Event consumers should not use this though, instead they could use correlationId attribute for uniquely identifying an event
The event should be ignored by consumers after the specified expire date and time
Business Event Type Hierarchy, i.e. AU/RETAIL/CARDS
Event should be ignored by the consumers
The date and time, to millisecond precision, that this event occurred
A unique OCV identifier for a party. A party can have multiple records in OCV. This and 'subject' would uniquely identify a Party Record within OCV
The service identifier that produced the event

The externalPartyIdentifier is an identifier which is NOT a Party Id, but can be used to correlate the Party to a Party Id. For example, a CRN could be used to correlate the customer, or a UUID, or a CAP CIS Id
Type of Identifier e.g., Passport / Driving License etc
A party can have multiple identifiers for the same identificationType and so this should also be considered as part of composite business key
This should also be considered as part of composite business key for this object
An array of strings that provide further context to the content of this specific message. For example, if the party is ANZx customer, events for that party would have an 'ANZx' tag
Type of Industry the Organisation is in
Type of Organisation
This would be the business key for uniquely identifying Organisation Name business object
Relationship end date
This would be the business key for uniquely identifying a Party-Account relation
Relationship start date
Privacy Preference Category. This is part of the business key for this object
Privacy Preference Type. This along with the category would be the business key for this object
The actual value of the identifier - that would be the actual CRN, for example

recordDescription.s: A party can have multiple records in OCV. This and 'ocvID' would uniquely identify a Party Record within OCV

fieldDescription.s: The type of identifier, such as CRN, or OCV Id, or CAPCISId

recordDescription.s: A party can have multiple records in OCV. This and 'ocvID' would uniquely identify a Party Record within OCV
A party can have multiple records in OCV. This and 'ocvID' would uniquely identify a Party Record within OCV

fieldDescription.s: A unique OCV identifier for the surviving party

recordDescription.s: Survivor Party Details for the Victim party
Survivor Party Details for the Victim party
Survivor Party Details for the Victim party
